intro: Alyxia hainanensis, commonly known as the Hainan alyxia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of southern China, particularly Hainan Island. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other flowering plants with characteristic latex sap. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, featuring opposite, ovate leaves and showy, tubular flowers that are often pink or white in color. Alyxia hainanensis is adapted to humid, warm climates and is often found in lowland forests or along stream banks. Its ornamental value and ecological role make it an important species in its native habitat.
